meanings.definition: To construct a levee to prevent flooding.
meanings.sent1: The workers leveed the riverbank to stop the water from overflowing.
meanings.sent2: The city leveed the area to protect it from the rising river.
meanings.sent3: The beavers were surprised to see humans leveeing their dam.
meanings.sent4: She leveed her defenses against the incoming flood of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The leveed barrier held back the floodwaters, saving the town from disaster.

meanings.definition: To impose a tax or fine on someone.
meanings.sent1: The government leveed a tax on all imported goods.
meanings.sent2: The court leveed a heavy fine on the reckless driver.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun leveed a tax on anyone passing through the forest.
meanings.sent4: The landlord leveed a penalty on the late rent payment.
meanings.sent5: The king leveed a tax on every household in the kingdom to fund the war effort.

meanings.sent1: She leveed the heavy box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The crane leveed the steel beam into place.
meanings.sent3: The magician leveed the rabbit out of the hat with a flourish.
meanings.sent4: The weightlifter leveed the barbell above his head with ease.
meanings.sent5: The elevator leveed the passengers to the top floor of the building.
